questions.question: Which event started World War I?
questions.correct_answer: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand

questions.question: Who was the leader of the Soviet Union during World War II?
What was the primary goal of the Congress of Vienna (1814-1815)?
questions.correct_answer: To restore stability and order in Europe after the Napoleonic Wars

questions.question: Which of the following was a major outcome of the Treaty of Versailles?
questions.correct_answer: Germany was forced to accept full responsibility for World War I

questions.question: Which event marked the beginning of the French Revolution?
Who was the first emperor of France?
What was the main cause of the Thirty Years' War?
questions.correct_answer: Religious conflict between Catholics and Protestants

questions.question: Which treaty ended the Thirty Years' War in 1648?
What was the Renaissance?
questions.correct_answer: A cultural revival of art, learning, and literature in Europe

questions.question: Which of the following monarchs is associated with the establishment of the Anglican Church?
Who was the leader of Nazi Germany during World War II?
What was the purpose of the Berlin Wall?
questions.correct_answer: To prevent East Germans from fleeing to West Berlin

questions.question: Which of the following philosophers is associated with the Enlightenment?
Who was the last Tsar of Russia before the Russian Revolution?
Which country was the first to industrialize in Europe?
What was the main cause of the Crimean War (1853-1856)?
questions.correct_answer: Disputes over the rights of Christian minorities in the Ottoman Empire

questions.question: Which empire was known as the 'sick man of Europe' during the 19th century?
What was the Black Death?
questions.correct_answer: A devastating pandemic that killed millions in Europe during the 14th century

questions.question: Which of the following was a key feature of the Enlightenment?
questions.correct_answer: A focus on reason, science, and individual rights

questions.question: Who was the leader of the Bolshevik Revolution in Russia in 1917?
Which conflict is known as 'The Great War'?
Which of the following countries was part of the Triple Alliance before World War I?
What was the primary purpose of the Marshall Plan after World War II?
questions.correct_answer: To provide economic aid to rebuild European economies

questions.question: Which French leader declared himself emperor in 1804?
What was the main result of the Glorious Revolution in England?
questions.correct_answer: The establishment of a constitutional monarchy

questions.question: Which document, signed in 1215, limited the power of the English king?
Which of the following events marked the end of Napoleon's rule?
Who was the primary author of the Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen?
What was the primary goal of the European Union when it was formed?
questions.correct_answer: To promote economic cooperation and prevent future conflicts in Europe

questions.question: Who was responsible for the Reign of Terror during the French Revolution?
Which Italian leader was instrumental in the unification of Italy?
What event led to the outbreak of World War II in Europe?
Which leader is associated with the policy of appeasement prior to World War II?
What was the main cause of the Spanish Civil War?
questions.correct_answer: A struggle between Republicans and Nationalists

questions.question: Which treaty established the European Economic Community (EEC)?
Which of the following monarchs is known for the English Reformation?
Which event marked the fall of the Western Roman Empire?
questions.correct_answer: The sack of Rome by barbarian tribes in 476 AD

questions.question: What was the main outcome of the Battle of Hastings in 1066?
questions.correct_answer: William the Conqueror became the king of England

questions.question: Which European city experienced a cultural and artistic revival during the Renaissance?
Which conflict is known as the longest-running war in European history?
Who was the Holy Roman Emperor during the Protestant Reformation?
Which battle is considered Napoleon's greatest defeat?
What was the main cause of the English Civil War?
questions.correct_answer: Conflict between the monarchy and Parliament

questions.question: Which treaty ended World War II in Europe?
Who was the first woman to be elected as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom?
What was the primary result of the 1848 Revolutions in Europe?
questions.correct_answer: The rise of nationalist and liberal movements

questions.question: What was the primary goal of the Spanish Inquisition?
Which European explorer is credited with discovering the Americas in 1492?
Which of the following was a major effect of the Protestant Reformation?
questions.correct_answer: The division of Christianity in Western Europe

questions.question: Who was the main leader of the Nazi Party in Germany?
